meanings.definition: The practice of transmuting base metals into gold.
meanings.sent1: In the old stories, wizards would use alchemies to turn ordinary metals into gold.
meanings.sent2: The ancient alchemies were believed to hold the secret to creating wealth from simple materials.
meanings.sent3: The alchemies of the past were like a mystical recipe for making riches out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to turn any situation into a success was like a modern-day alchemies.
meanings.sent5: The alchemies of the past were as elusive as finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.

meanings.definition: A seemingly magical process of transformation, creation, or combination.
meanings.sent1: The alchemies of nature can be seen in the changing of seasons from winter to spring.
meanings.sent2: The artist's alchemies turned a blank canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: Watching the chef work in the kitchen was like witnessing alchemies in action.
meanings.sent4: The alchemies of love can bring together even the most unlikely of couples.
meanings.sent5: The alchemies of creativity can turn a simple idea into a work of art.
